message: see ya
So as we all try and get on google plus! What do we actually think of it?
True
that's all google's ever been good at is "austere" interfaces
heh
mgkimsal@gmail.com :)
it's like a barebones facebook.
It needs an api though
no farmville woohoo
"more" potential than what?  facebook?
mail is getting a new interface in next couple of days
i think they are goona add a slew of new stuff to all apps and them bring together using plus

however... it makes me think that g+ may remain a 'techies social network'  or 'techies and biz people'.  people aren't going to leave facebook's farmville so they can create slides on google docs via g+
g+ will probably expand the pie of active users of "social networks" rather than cause a mass exodus from facebook
which were a welcome relief from the 90s dotcom portal ads everywhere "search engines" of yore
but they don't have any other feel, so they'll already alienate some people who prefer the hominess of fb
no i hate those people who have been using ie for 15 years and word and still think hotmail is the best thing ever
they also need a way to capture notes about relationships.
they're missing this great opportunity to get people rethinking about their contacts/relationships, and deepening the value/hold google offers.
perhaps it'll make 'notes' more up front
Maybe yeah hadnt thought of that
lol
there's some nice things in g+, but still loads of stuff that could be done to differentiate it more.  it's mostly like a nicer skin on facebook
the hangout with video sharing is a nice new piece
though having tried it for a few mintues, I realize why video calls/chat will never replace regular text chat - people can see when I'm not paying attention.  makes it *very* hard to multitask.
wave, buzz, etc.  "good coders" and "great innovators" don't necessarily (or maybe even usually) mean popular success.
fb isn't gonna sit still.  the game is still facebook's to lose.

yeh but they have video here better organising and they have immediate upload already! Something that might actually go against apple! Plus they are rebranding all services at moment so can you imagine it with docs, calender and everything other google app
hotmail
where did I meet this person?  when?  etc.
I can do it in gmail contacts, though I find that a bit hidden from day to day usage
I just think it has so much potential and google have always been the best and most open coders and the greatest innovators
this how redesign and stuff does have a much more corporate feel than usual
i read about that
gotta run - l8r
Yeh but i reckon it has so much more potential already if done right
yeh facebook
for certain settings, that won't matter, but that's what will keep video communication as a niche medium for generations.
there's potentially a lot of integration they can do, certainly, yes.  It remains to be seen but they're positioned well for that.
i think people who migrate or just join will start to use the web more i find that people that move to gmail start to use docs and stuff and i think this will help with the whole cloud movement!
i think the whole invite thing will start to spark there is so much talk but yeah your right! I wish we were allowed to have a button that said invite your facebook friends
much like fb felt 'clean' and 'simple' after myspace for many people, g+ may be seen as the buttoned-down version of social networking for people who never liked facebook.
yep i never really liked it though
it won't hurt

i just feel like there's gotta be something more to spark a larger influx/migration, if that's what people are expecting, otherwise it'll be a slower pace of migration/change/adoption.  it's not bad, but it won't seem as instantaneous otherwise.
just putting people in circles isn't enough (fb has 'lists' already too).  circles is a nicer UI, but I want to capture/store info about the relationship
when I'm importing and adding people to my circles is a perfect time to do that.
which'd be helpful to me
i should add you too one of my circles lol
It might b like only by techi people

As a user experience, I vastly prefer it to Facebook, I also like it's twitter/blogginess; has the potential to be a real one stop shop for stuff I want, both social and informative. That said, I'll wait for all the non-techies to arrive before calling it awesome, because lets face it, without good and proper uptake, it'll be far from awesome.
google integrated its services in g+, so it's not just a 'FACEBOOK' like service, but a kinda ultimate product by google
The enterprise strategy definitely seems promissing.
love it

It's google's social glue for it's services. Just wait and see how this will evolve (and grow) when it opens to Google Apps users, it could be even threatening for enterprise focused products such as Salesforce.com Chatter.

It's a great way for google to allow users to self-identify interests and related people, so google can even further pare down search results tailored to exactly YOU. I find it both exciting and creepy.
